title: Bounds on the minimum sound speed above neutron star densities
abstract:
We show that the existence of massive neutron stars and asymptotic freedom of
QCD place robust upper bounds on the lowest sound speed of the ultra-dense
matter unattainable in neutron stars. Our approach does not rely on explicitly
representing the equation of state in the density range $\sim 2-40 n_0$, and
does not require probabilistic interpretations. The upper limit decreases
rapidly when the maximum mass of neutron stars is greater than about
$2.5M_\odot$. Discovery of $\sim 3 M_\odot$ neutron stars would strongly
support first-order phase transitions at high baryon densities
